DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Alpelisib works by blocking the activity of a protein called PI3K-alpha that signals cells to multiply. It also blocks mutant (overactive) versions of this protein found in cancer cells. This may keep cancer cells from growing and may kill them. Alpelisib is a type of targeted therapy drug called an enzyme inhibitor. It is a small-molecule drug (a drug that can enter cells easily).

Section.Title: Use in Cancer

ItemizedList.ListItem: Breast cancer that is hormone receptor positive and HER2 negative and has a mutation in the PIK3CA gene. It is used with fulvestrant to treat postmenopausal women, and men, whose breast cancer has spread and has gotten worse during or after treatment with hormone therapy.

Section.Para: Alpelisib is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
